Resources Related to the mosaic Package

  • Stats: Data and Models in R (Horton) describes how to undertake analyses in De Veaux, Velleman, and Bockâ€™s Stats: Data and Models (4th edition). These materials can be found here.
  • Introduction to the Practice of Statistics in R (NJ Horton and BS Baumer) describes how to undertake analyses in R that are introduced as examples in the first chapters of Introduction to the Practice of Statistics (6th edition), the excellent text by David Moore, George McCabe, and Bruce Craig. IPS in R can be found here.
  • The Statistical Sleuth in R (NJ Horton) describes how to undertake analyses in R for the examples in the first 13 chapters of the Third Edition of the Statistical Sleuth: A Course in Methods of Data Analysis (2013), by Fred Ramsey and Dan Schafer. The materials can be found here.
  • A paper describing the mosaic package Less Volume, More Creativity appraoch can be found here.
  • Additional mosaic-related resources and documentation listed here.
  • Additional mosaic package vignettes listed here.
